metadata.name: G. Melonella Action
metadata.description:
Collaboration with Alexander Makarov and Alexander Sokolov
As part of the work "G. Mellonella Action, we turned to the recycling of polyethylene and polypropylene. By the end of 2015, the amount of all plastic waste reached 5800 million tons. There is so much plastic waste that it seems that this waste is starting to take on a life of its own. They “capture” cities, move along roads, drawn by the wind, create islands in the Pacific Ocean, break up into small pieces under the influence of the environment, turning into microplastics. Waste takes the form of complex global networks, developing at times the most
in an unexpected way. To take control of these
complex processes and prevent an ecological catastrophe
society needs awareness and awareness. A task
project - updating the problem of recycling
plastic waste and finding a solution to the problem.
We will donate a portion of the proceeds to
"SahaXenos" so that they can
continue your research.
